about_the_game:
The goal of this 2D RPG is not to kill dragons, but to use the skills and buffs provided by the game to control "which skills are used" and "who dies first" to obtain different game endings.

Most of the plots are related to a same theme: "the law of the jungle".

The law of the jungle used to be the survival rule of mankind for a long time. It's my description to the human old society in this game , but this has never been a value that I advocate, - I have to write this clearly here.

Almost all the game assets come from the official free asset package "Dragon Crashers" on assetstore of Unity. "All content can be added to your own creative projects," the website said. I also wrote an email to Unity to ask if I can use this asset for commercial use, and got a positive reply from Unity.

Someones told me that using this set of assets will be scolded by players or other developers.

But I think using authorized free resources should not deserve a horrible abuse. So I use it.

I would like to thank Unity and the original authors of these resources.



In my first two works: "Human Origin" tells a story of a zombie man who helps alien humans invade the earth; In the "Human Origin: Liu Lanzhi", although the protagonist is "Liu Lanzhi", one branch introduces the alien human leaders who invading the earth are PanGu and NvWa, and further introduces how the zombie man became a helmet knight and be cursed into the final boss.

In "who dies first", there are five plots related to the story line of "Human Origin", which introduce how PanGu and NvWa came to the earth from aliens planet : PanGu and NvWa were original human and their prisoners. They were used for biochemical experiments. A student of original human scientists observed that through a variation they could breathe oxygen. He thought that as long as they were placed on an oxygen rich planet, they could survive as "another possibility of human beings"......
detailed_description:
The goal of this 2D RPG is not to kill dragons, but to use the skills and buffs provided by the game to control "which skills are used" and "who dies first" to obtain different game endings.

Most of the plots are related to a same theme: "the law of the jungle".

The law of the jungle used to be the survival rule of mankind for a long time. It's my description to the human old society in this game , but this has never been a value that I advocate, - I have to write this clearly here.

Almost all the game assets come from the official free asset package "Dragon Crashers" on assetstore of Unity. "All content can be added to your own creative projects," the website said. I also wrote an email to Unity to ask if I can use this asset for commercial use, and got a positive reply from Unity.

Someones told me that using this set of assets will be scolded by players or other developers.

But I think using authorized free resources should not deserve a horrible abuse. So I use it.

I would like to thank Unity and the original authors of these resources.



In my first two works: "Human Origin" tells a story of a zombie man who helps alien humans invade the earth; In the "Human Origin: Liu Lanzhi", although the protagonist is "Liu Lanzhi", one branch introduces the alien human leaders who invading the earth are PanGu and NvWa, and further introduces how the zombie man became a helmet knight and be cursed into the final boss.

In "who dies first", there are five plots related to the story line of "Human Origin", which introduce how PanGu and NvWa came to the earth from aliens planet : PanGu and NvWa were original human and their prisoners. They were used for biochemical experiments. A student of original human scientists observed that through a variation they could breathe oxygen. He thought that as long as they were placed on an oxygen rich planet, they could survive as "another possibility of human beings"......
legal_notice: This game uses open source protocol contents, including software, code, music, pictures and other materials. For details, please refer to the ThirdPartyNotices document under the game installation directory.
name: Who dies first

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7/8/10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 2GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Graphics Card With 1GB Memory
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: The darkest game in 2022 , depends not only on how dark it is, but also on how dark readers can imagine it. The goal of the game is not to kill dragons, but to control "which character releases skills" and "which character dies first" to obtain different game endings.
